member.name: T:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric
member.summary:
Flags used with the Windows API (User32.dll):GetSystemMetrics(SystemMetric smIndex)
This Enum and declaration signature was written by Gabriel T. Sharp ai_productions@verizon.net or osirisgothra@hotmail.com Obtained on pinvoke.net, please contribute your code to support the wiki!

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_ARRANGE
member.summary: The flags that specify how the system arranged minimized windows. For more information, see the Remarks section in this topic.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CLEANBOOT
member.summary: The value that specifies how the system is started: 0 Normal boot 1 Fail-safe boot 2 Fail-safe with network boot A fail-safe boot (also called SafeBoot, Safe Mode, or Clean Boot) bypasses the user startup files.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CMONITORS
member.summary: The number of display monitors on a desktop. For more information, see the Remarks section in this topic.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CMOUSEBUTTONS
member.summary: The number of buttons on a mouse, or zero if no mouse is installed.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXBORDER
member.summary: The width of a window border, in pixels. This is equivalent to the SM_CXEDGE value for windows with the 3-D look.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXCURSOR
member.summary: The width of a cursor, in pixels. The system cannot create cursors of other sizes.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXDLGFRAME
member.summary: This value is the same as SM_CXFIXEDFRAME.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXDOUBLECLK
member.summary: The width of the rectangle around the location of a first click in a double-click sequence, in pixels. , The second click must occur within the rectangle that is defined by SM_CXDOUBLECLK and SM_CYDOUBLECLK for the system to consider the two clicks a double-click. The two clicks must also occur within a specified time. To set the width of the double-click rectangle, call SystemParametersInfo with SPI_SETDOUBLECLKWIDTH.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXDRAG
member.summary: The number of pixels on either side of a mouse-down point that the mouse pointer can move before a drag operation begins. This allows the user to click and release the mouse button easily without unintentionally starting a drag operation. If this value is negative, it is subtracted from the left of the mouse-down point and added to the right of it.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXEDGE
member.summary: The width of a 3-D border, in pixels. This metric is the 3-D counterpart of SM_CXBORDER.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXFIXEDFRAME
member.summary: The thickness of the frame around the perimeter of a window that has a caption but is not sizable, in pixels. SM_CXFIXEDFRAME is the height of the horizontal border, and SM_CYFIXEDFRAME is the width of the vertical border. This value is the same as SM_CXDLGFRAME.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXFOCUSBORDER
member.summary: The width of the left and right edges of the focus rectangle that the DrawFocusRectdraws. This value is in pixels. Windows 2000: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXFRAME
member.summary: This value is the same as SM_CXSIZEFRAME.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXFULLSCREEN
member.summary: The width of the client area for a full-screen window on the primary display monitor, in pixels. To get the coordinates of the portion of the screen that is not obscured by the system taskbar or by application desktop toolbars, call the SystemParametersInfofunction with the SPI_GETWORKAREA value.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXHSCROLL
member.summary: The width of the arrow bitmap on a horizontal scroll bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXHTHUMB
member.summary: The width of the thumb box in a horizontal scroll bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXICON
member.summary: The default width of an icon, in pixels. The LoadIcon function can load only icons with the dimensions that SM_CXICON and SM_CYICON specifies.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXICONSPACING
member.summary: The width of a grid cell for items in large icon view, in pixels. Each item fits into a rectangle of size SM_CXICONSPACING by SM_CYICONSPACING when arranged. This value is always greater than or equal to SM_CXICON.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXMAXIMIZED
member.summary: The default width, in pixels, of a maximized top-level window on the primary display monitor.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXMAXTRACK
member.summary: The default maximum width of a window that has a caption and sizing borders, in pixels. This metric refers to the entire desktop. The user cannot drag the window frame to a size larger than these dimensions. A window can override this value by processing the WM_GETMINMAXINFO message.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXMENUCHECK
member.summary: The width of the default menu check-mark bitmap, in pixels.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXMENUSIZE
member.summary: The width of menu bar buttons, such as the child window close button that is used in the multiple document interface, in pixels.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXMIN
member.summary: The minimum width of a window, in pixels.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXMINIMIZED
member.summary: The width of a minimized window, in pixels.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXMINSPACING
member.summary: The width of a grid cell for a minimized window, in pixels. Each minimized window fits into a rectangle this size when arranged. This value is always greater than or equal to SM_CXMINIMIZED.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXMINTRACK
member.summary: The minimum tracking width of a window, in pixels. The user cannot drag the window frame to a size smaller than these dimensions. A window can override this value by processing the WM_GETMINMAXINFO message.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXPADDEDBORDER
member.summary: The amount of border padding for captioned windows, in pixels. Windows XP/2000: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXSCREEN
member.summary: The width of the screen of the primary display monitor, in pixels. This is the same value obtained by calling GetDeviceCaps as follows: GetDeviceCaps( hdcPrimaryMonitor, HORZRES).

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXSIZE
member.summary: The width of a button in a window caption or title bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXSIZEFRAME
member.summary: The thickness of the sizing border around the perimeter of a window that can be resized, in pixels. SM_CXSIZEFRAME is the width of the horizontal border, and SM_CYSIZEFRAME is the height of the vertical border. This value is the same as SM_CXFRAME.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXSMICON
member.summary: The recommended width of a small icon, in pixels. Small icons typically appear in window captions and in small icon view.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXSMSIZE
member.summary: The width of small caption buttons, in pixels.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXVIRTUALSCREEN
member.summary: The width of the virtual screen, in pixels. The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors. The SM_XVIRTUALSCREEN metric is the coordinates for the left side of the virtual screen.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CXVSCROLL
member.summary: The width of a vertical scroll bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYBORDER
member.summary: The height of a window border, in pixels. This is equivalent to the SM_CYEDGE value for windows with the 3-D look.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYCAPTION
member.summary: The height of a caption area, in pixels.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYCURSOR
member.summary: The height of a cursor, in pixels. The system cannot create cursors of other sizes.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYDLGFRAME
member.summary: This value is the same as SM_CYFIXEDFRAME.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYDOUBLECLK
member.summary: The height of the rectangle around the location of a first click in a double-click sequence, in pixels. The second click must occur within the rectangle defined by SM_CXDOUBLECLK and SM_CYDOUBLECLK for the system to consider the two clicks a double-click. The two clicks must also occur within a specified time. To set the height of the double-click rectangle, call SystemParametersInfo with SPI_SETDOUBLECLKHEIGHT.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYDRAG
member.summary: The number of pixels above and below a mouse-down point that the mouse pointer can move before a drag operation begins. This allows the user to click and release the mouse button easily without unintentionally starting a drag operation. If this value is negative, it is subtracted from above the mouse-down point and added below it.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYEDGE
member.summary: The height of a 3-D border, in pixels. This is the 3-D counterpart of SM_CYBORDER.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYFIXEDFRAME
member.summary: The thickness of the frame around the perimeter of a window that has a caption but is not sizable, in pixels. SM_CXFIXEDFRAME is the height of the horizontal border, and SM_CYFIXEDFRAME is the width of the vertical border. This value is the same as SM_CYDLGFRAME.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYFOCUSBORDER
member.summary: The height of the top and bottom edges of the focus rectangle drawn byDrawFocusRect. This value is in pixels. Windows 2000: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYFRAME
member.summary: This value is the same as SM_CYSIZEFRAME.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYFULLSCREEN
member.summary: The height of the client area for a full-screen window on the primary display monitor, in pixels. To get the coordinates of the portion of the screen not obscured by the system taskbar or by application desktop toolbars, call the SystemParametersInfo function with the SPI_GETWORKAREA value.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYHSCROLL
member.summary: The height of a horizontal scroll bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYICON
member.summary: The default height of an icon, in pixels. The LoadIcon function can load only icons with the dimensions SM_CXICON and SM_CYICON.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYICONSPACING
member.summary: The height of a grid cell for items in large icon view, in pixels. Each item fits into a rectangle of size SM_CXICONSPACING by SM_CYICONSPACING when arranged. This value is always greater than or equal to SM_CYICON.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYKANJIWINDOW
member.summary: For double byte character set versions of the system, this is the height of the Kanji window at the bottom of the screen, in pixels.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYMAXIMIZED
member.summary: The default height, in pixels, of a maximized top-level window on the primary display monitor.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYMAXTRACK
member.summary: The default maximum height of a window that has a caption and sizing borders, in pixels. This metric refers to the entire desktop. The user cannot drag the window frame to a size larger than these dimensions. A window can override this value by processing the WM_GETMINMAXINFO message.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYMENU
member.summary: The height of a single-line menu bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYMENUCHECK
member.summary: The height of the default menu check-mark bitmap, in pixels.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYMENUSIZE
member.summary: The height of menu bar buttons, such as the child window close button that is used in the multiple document interface, in pixels.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYMIN
member.summary: The minimum height of a window, in pixels.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYMINIMIZED
member.summary: The height of a minimized window, in pixels.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYMINSPACING
member.summary: The height of a grid cell for a minimized window, in pixels. Each minimized window fits into a rectangle this size when arranged. This value is always greater than or equal to SM_CYMINIMIZED.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYMINTRACK
member.summary: The minimum tracking height of a window, in pixels. The user cannot drag the window frame to a size smaller than these dimensions. A window can override this value by processing the WM_GETMINMAXINFO message.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYSCREEN
member.summary: The height of the screen of the primary display monitor, in pixels. This is the same value obtained by calling GetDeviceCaps as follows: GetDeviceCaps( hdcPrimaryMonitor, VERTRES).

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYSIZE
member.summary: The height of a button in a window caption or title bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYSIZEFRAME
member.summary: The thickness of the sizing border around the perimeter of a window that can be resized, in pixels. SM_CXSIZEFRAME is the width of the horizontal border, and SM_CYSIZEFRAME is the height of the vertical border. This value is the same as SM_CYFRAME.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYSMCAPTION
member.summary: The height of a small caption, in pixels.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYSMICON
member.summary: The recommended height of a small icon, in pixels. Small icons typically appear in window captions and in small icon view.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYSMSIZE
member.summary: The height of small caption buttons, in pixels.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYVIRTUALSCREEN
member.summary: The height of the virtual screen, in pixels. The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors. The SM_YVIRTUALSCREEN metric is the coordinates for the top of the virtual screen.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYVSCROLL
member.summary: The height of the arrow bitmap on a vertical scroll bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_CYVTHUMB
member.summary: The height of the thumb box in a vertical scroll bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_DBCSENABLED
member.summary: Nonzero if User32.dll supports DBCS; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_DEBUG
member.summary: Nonzero if the debug version of User.exe is installed; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_DIGITIZER
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is Windows 7 or Windows Server 2008 R2 and the Tablet PC Input service is started; otherwise, 0. The return value is a bitmask that specifies the type of digitizer input supported by the device. For more information, see Remarks. Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, and Windows XP/2000: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_IMMENABLED
member.summary: Nonzero if Input Method Manager/Input Method Editor features are enabled; otherwise, 0. SM_IMMENABLED indicates whether the system is ready to use a Unicode-based IME on a Unicode application. To ensure that a language-dependent IME works, check SM_DBCSENABLED and the system ANSI code page. Otherwise the ANSI-to-Unicode conversion may not be performed correctly, or some components like fonts or registry settings may not be present.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_MAXIMUMTOUCHES
member.summary: Nonzero if there are digitizers in the system; otherwise, 0. SM_MAXIMUMTOUCHES returns the aggregate maximum of the maximum number of contacts supported by every digitizer in the system. If the system has only single-touch digitizers, the return value is 1. If the system has multi-touch digitizers, the return value is the number of simultaneous contacts the hardware can provide. Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, and Windows XP/2000: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_MEDIACENTER
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is the Windows XP, Media Center Edition, 0 if not.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_MENUDROPALIGNMENT
member.summary: Nonzero if drop-down menus are right-aligned with the corresponding menu-bar item; 0 if the menus are left-aligned.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_MIDEASTENABLED
member.summary: Nonzero if the system is enabled for Hebrew and Arabic languages, 0 if not.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_MOUSEPRESENT
member.summary: Nonzero if a mouse is installed; otherwise, 0. This value is rarely zero, because of support for virtual mice and because some systems detect the presence of the port instead of the presence of a mouse.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_MOUSEHORIZONTALWHEELPRESENT
member.summary: Nonzero if a mouse with a horizontal scroll wheel is installed; otherwise 0.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_MOUSEWHEELPRESENT
member.summary: Nonzero if a mouse with a vertical scroll wheel is installed; otherwise 0.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_NETWORK
member.summary: The least significant bit is set if a network is present; otherwise, it is cleared. The other bits are reserved for future use.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_PENWINDOWS
member.summary: Nonzero if the Microsoft Windows for Pen computing extensions are installed; zero otherwise.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_REMOTECONTROL
member.summary: This system metric is used in a Terminal Services environment to determine if the current Terminal Server session is being remotely controlled. Its value is nonzero if the current session is remotely controlled; otherwise, 0. You can use terminal services management tools such as Terminal Services Manager (tsadmin.msc) and shadow.exe to control a remote session. When a session is being remotely controlled, another user can view the contents of that session and potentially interact with it.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_REMOTESESSION
member.summary: This system metric is used in a Terminal Services environment. If the calling process is associated with a Terminal Services client session, the return value is nonzero. If the calling process is associated with the Terminal Services console session, the return value is 0. Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: The console session is not necessarily the physical console. For more information, seeWTSGetActiveConsoleSessionId.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_SAMEDISPLAYFORMAT
member.summary: Nonzero if all the display monitors have the same color format, otherwise, 0. Two displays can have the same bit depth, but different color formats. For example, the red, green, and blue pixels can be encoded with different numbers of bits, or those bits can be located in different places in a pixel color value.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_SECURE
member.summary: This system metric should be ignored; it always returns 0.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_SERVERR2
member.summary: The build number if the system is Windows Server 2003 R2; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_SHOWSOUNDS
member.summary: Nonzero if the user requires an application to present information visually in situations where it would otherwise present the information only in audible form; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_SHUTTINGDOWN
member.summary: Nonzero if the current session is shutting down; otherwise, 0. Windows 2000: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_SLOWMACHINE
member.summary: Nonzero if the computer has a low-end (slow) processor; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_STARTER
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is Windows 7 Starter Edition, Windows Vista Starter, or Windows XP Starter Edition; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_SWAPBUTTON
member.summary: Nonzero if the meanings of the left and right mouse buttons are swapped; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_TABLETPC
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is the Windows XP Tablet PC edition or if the current operating system is Windows Vista or Windows 7 and the Tablet PC Input service is started; otherwise, 0. The SM_DIGITIZER setting indicates the type of digitizer input supported by a device running Windows 7 or Windows Server 2008 R2. For more information, see Remarks.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_XVIRTUALSCREEN
member.summary: The coordinates for the left side of the virtual screen. The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors. The SM_CXVIRTUALSCREEN metric is the width of the virtual screen.

member.name: F:KryptonExtendedToolkit.Base.Code.PI.SystemMetric.SM_YVIRTUALSCREEN
member.summary: The coordinates for the top of the virtual screen. The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors. The SM_CYVIRTUALSCREEN metric is the height of the virtual screen.

member.summary: A standard Krypton button control with UAC shield Modified from the AeroSuite project.
member.remarks: The shield is extracted from the system with LoadImage if possible. Otherwise the shield will be enabled by sending the BCM_SETSHIELD Message to the control. If the operating system is not Windows Vista or higher, no shield will be displayed as there's no such thing as UAC on the target system -> the shield is obsolete.

member.name: T:KryptonExtendedToolkit.ExtendedToolkit.ToolstripControls.ToolStripMenuItemUACSheld
member.summary: A standard tool strip menu item control with UAC shield. Modified from the AeroSuite project.
member.remarks: The shield is extracted from the system with LoadImage if possible. Otherwise the shield will be enabled by sending the BCM_SETSHIELD Message to the control. If the operating system is not Windows Vista or higher, no shield will be displayed as there's no such thing as UAC on the target system -> the shield is obsolete.

member.name: M:ExtendedControls.Base.Code.Security.VirusTotalAPI.RescanFilesAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.IO.Stream})
member.summary: Tell VirusTotal to rescan a file. Note: This does not send the content of the streams to VirusTotal. It hashes the content and sends that instead. Note: Before requesting a rescan you should retrieve the latest report on the files.

member.name: M:ExtendedControls.Base.Code.Security.VirusTotalAPI.RescanFilesAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Tell VirusTotal to rescan a file. Note: This does not send the files to VirusTotal. It hashes the file and sends that instead. Note: Before requesting a rescan you should retrieve the latest report on the files. Note: You can use MD5, SHA1 or SHA256 and even mix them. Note: You can only request a maximum of 25 rescans at the time.
member.param: a MD5, SHA1 or SHA256 of the files. You can also specify list made up of a combination of any of the three allowed hashes (up to 25 items), this allows you to perform a batch request with one single call.

member.summary: Gets the report of the file represented by its hash or scan ID. Keep in mind that URLs sent using the API have the lowest scanning priority, depending on VirusTotal's load, it may take several hours before the file is scanned, so query the report at regular intervals until the result shows up and do not keep submitting the file over and over again.
member.param: SHA1, MD5 or SHA256 of the file. It can also be a scan ID of a previous scan.

member.summary: Line number style index. This style is used for text in line number margins. The background color of this style also sets the background color for all margins that do not have any folding mask set.

member.summary: Call tip style index. Only font name, size, foreground color, background color, and character set attributes can be used when displaying a call tip.

member.summary: Indent guide style index. This style is used to specify the foreground and background colors of .

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Classes.Style.BraceLight
member.summary: Brace highlighting style index. This style is used on a brace character when set with the method or the indentation guide when used with the property.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Classes.Style.BraceBad
member.summary: Bad brace style index. This style is used on an unmatched brace character when set with the method.

member.summary: Styles the specified character positions with the style.

The zero-based document position of the close brace character.
member.remarks: Brace highlighting can be removed by specifying for and .

member.name: M:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Controls.Scintilla.BraceMatch(System.Int32)
member.summary: Finds a corresponding matching brace starting at the position specified. The brace characters handled are '(', ')', '[', ']', '{', '}', '<', and '>'.
member.param: The zero-based document position of a brace character to start the search from for a matching brace character.
member.returns: The zero-based document position of the corresponding matching brace or it no matching brace could be found.
member.remarks: A match only occurs if the style of the matching brace is the same as the starting brace. Nested braces are handled correctly.

member.name: M:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Controls.Scintilla.CallTipShow(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Displays a call tip window.
member.param: The zero-based document position where the call tip window should be aligned.
The call tip text.
member.remarks: Call tips can contain multiple lines separated by '\n' characters. Do not include '\r', as this will most likely print as an empty box. The '\t' character is supported and the size can be set by using .

member.name: M:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Controls.Scintilla.CallTipTabSize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the call tip tab size in pixels.

member.name: M:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Controls.Scintilla.ReplaceTargetRe(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces the target text defined by and with the specified value after first substituting "\1" through "\9" macros in the with the most recent regular expression capture groups.
member.param: The text containing "\n" macros that will be substituted with the most recent regular expression capture groups and then replace the current target.
member.returns: The length of the replaced text.
member.remarks: The "\0" macro will be substituted by the entire matched text from the most recent search. The and properties will be updated to the start and end positions of the replaced text.

member.remarks: When getting this property, the return value is Math.Max(, ). When setting this property, is set to the value specified and set to Math.Min(, ). The caret is not scrolled into view.

member.name: P:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Controls.Scintilla.SelectionEolFilled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to fill past the end of a line with the selection background color.
member.returns: true to fill past the end of the line; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Controls.Scintilla.SelectionStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the start position of the selection.
member.returns: The zero-based document position where the selection starts.
member.remarks: When getting this property, the return value is Math.Min(, ). When setting this property, is set to the value specified and set to Math.Max(, ). The caret is not scrolled into view.

member.name: T:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.FontQuality
member.summary: The font quality (anti aliasing method) used to render text.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.FontQuality.DEFAULT
member.summary: Specifies that the character quality of the font does not matter; so the lowest quality can be used. This is the default.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.FontQuality.NONANTIALIASED
member.summary: Specifies that anti-aliasing should not be used when rendering text.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.FontQuality.ANTIALIASED
member.summary: Specifies that anti-aliasing should be used when rendering text, if the font supports it.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.FontQuality.LCDOPTIMIZED
member.summary: Specifies that ClearType anti-aliasing should be used when rendering text, if the font supports it.

member.name: T:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IdleStyling
member.summary: Possible strategies for styling text using application idle time.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IdleStyling.NONE
member.summary: Syntax styling is performed for all the currently visible text before displaying it. This is the default.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IdleStyling.TOVISIBLE
member.summary: A small amount of styling is performed before display and then further styling is performed incrementally in the background as an idle-time task. This can improve initial display/scroll performance, but may result in the text initially appearing uncolored and then, some time later, it is colored.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IdleStyling.AFTERVISIBLE
member.summary: Text after the currently visible portion may be styled as an idle-time task. This will not improve initial display/scroll performance, but may improve subsequent display/scroll performance.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IdleStyling.ALL
member.summary: Text before and after the current visible text. This is a combination of and .

member.name: T:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndentView
member.summary: Options for displaying indentation guides in a control.
member.remarks: Indentation guides can be styled using the style.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndentView.NONE
member.summary: No indentation guides are shown. This is the default.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndentView.REAL
member.summary: Indentation guides are shown inside real indentation whitespace.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndentView.LOOKFORWARD
member.summary: Indentation guides are shown beyond the actual indentation up to the level of the next non-empty line. If the previous non-empty line was a fold header then indentation guides are shown for one more level of indent than that line. This setting is good for Python.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndentView.LOOKBOTH
member.summary: Indentation guides are shown beyond the actual indentation up to the level of the next non-empty line or previous non-empty line whichever is the greater. This setting is good for most languages.

member.name: T:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndicatorFlags
member.summary: Flags associated with a .
member.remarks: This enumeration has a FlagsAttribute attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndicatorFlags.NONE
member.summary: No flags. This is the default.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndicatorFlags.VALUEFORE
member.summary: When set, will treat an indicator value as a RGB color that has been OR'd with and will use that instead of the value specified in the property. This allows an indicator to display more than one color.

member.name: T:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndicatorStyle
member.summary: The visual appearance of an indicator.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndicatorStyle.PLAIN
member.summary: Underlined with a single, straight line.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndicatorStyle.SQUIGGLE
member.summary: A squiggly underline. Requires 3 pixels of descender space.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndicatorStyle.TT
member.summary: A line of small T shapes.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndicatorStyle.DIAGONAL
member.summary: Diagonal hatching.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndicatorStyle.STRIKE
member.summary: Strike out.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndicatorStyle.HIDDEN
member.summary: An indicator with no visual effect.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndicatorStyle.BOX
member.summary: A rectangle around the text.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndicatorStyle.ROUNDBOX
member.summary: A rectangle around the text with rounded corners. The rectangle outline and fill transparencies can be adjusted using and .

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndicatorStyle.STRAIGHTBOX
member.summary: A rectangle around the text. The rectangle outline and fill transparencies can be adjusted using and .

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndicatorStyle.DASH
member.summary: A dashed underline.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndicatorStyle.DOTS
member.summary: A dotted underline.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndicatorStyle.SQUIGGLELOW
member.summary: Similar to but only using 2 vertical pixels so will fit under small fonts.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndicatorStyle.DOTBOX
member.summary: A dotted rectangle around the text. The dots transparencies can be adjusted using and .

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndicatorStyle.COMPOSITIONTHICK
member.summary: A 2-pixel thick underline with 1 pixel insets on either side.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndicatorStyle.COMPOSITIONTHIN
member.summary: A 1-pixel thick underline with 1 pixel insets on either side.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndicatorStyle.FULLBOX
member.summary: A rectangle around the entire character area. The rectangle outline and fill transparencies can be adjusted using and .

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndicatorStyle.TEXTFORE
member.summary: An indicator that will change the foreground color of text to the foreground color of the indicator.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndicatorStyle.POINT
member.summary: A triangle below the start of the indicator range.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.IndicatorStyle.POINTCHARACTER
member.summary: A triangle below the center of the first character of the indicator range.

member.name: T:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.MarkerSymbol
member.summary: The symbol displayed by a

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.MarkerSymbol.CIRCLE
member.summary: A circle. This symbol is typically used to indicate a breakpoint.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.MarkerSymbol.ROUNDRECT
member.summary: A rectangel with rounded edges.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.MarkerSymbol.ARROW
member.summary: An arrow (triangle) pointing right.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.MarkerSymbol.SMALLRECT
member.summary: A rectangle that is wider than it is tall.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.MarkerSymbol.SHORTARROW
member.summary: An arrow and tail pointing right. This symbol is typically used to indicate the current line of execution.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.MarkerSymbol.EMPTY
member.summary: An invisible symbol useful for tracking the movement of lines.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.MarkerSymbol.ARROWDOWN
member.summary: An arrow (triangle) pointing down.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.MarkerSymbol.MINUS
member.summary: A minus (-) symbol.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.MarkerSymbol.PLUS
member.summary: A plus (+) symbol.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.MarkerSymbol.VLINE
member.summary: A thin vertical line. This symbol is typically used on the middle line of an expanded fold block.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.MarkerSymbol.LCORNER
member.summary: A thin 'L' shaped line. This symbol is typically used on the last line of an expanded fold block.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.MarkerSymbol.TCORNER
member.summary: A thin 't' shaped line. This symbol is typically used on the last line of an expanded nested fold block.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.MarkerSymbol.BOXPLUS
member.summary: A plus (+) symbol with surrounding box. This symbol is typically used on the first line of a collapsed fold block.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.MarkerSymbol.BOXPLUSCONNECTED
member.summary: A plus (+) symbol with surrounding box and thin vertical line. This symbol is typically used on the first line of a collapsed nested fold block.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.MarkerSymbol.BOXMINUS
member.summary: A minus (-) symbol with surrounding box. This symbol is typically used on the first line of an expanded fold block.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.MarkerSymbol.BOXMINUSCONNECTED
member.summary: A minus (-) symbol with surrounding box and thin vertical line. This symbol is typically used on the first line of an expanded nested fold block.

member.summary: Similar to a , but curved.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.MarkerSymbol.TCORNERCURVE
member.summary: Similar to a , but curved.

member.summary: Similar to a , but surrounded by a circle.

member.summary: Similar to a , but surrounded by a circle.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.MarkerSymbol.CIRCLEMINUSCONNECTED
member.summary: Similar to a , but surrounded by a circle.

member.name: T:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.MultiPaste
member.summary: Specifies the behavior of pasting into multiple selections.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.MultiPaste.ONCE
member.summary: Pasting into multiple selections only pastes to the main selection. This is the default.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.MultiPaste.EACH
member.summary: Pasting into multiple selections pastes into each selection.

member.name: T:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.Order
member.summary: The sorting order for autocompletion lists.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.Order.PRESORTED
member.summary: Requires that an autocompletion lists be sorted in alphabetical order. This is the default.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.Order.PERFORMSORT
member.summary: Instructs a control to perform an alphabetical sort of autocompletion lists.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.Order.CUSTOM
member.summary: User-defined order.

member.name: T:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.Phases
member.summary: The number of phases used when drawing.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.Phases.ONE
member.summary: Drawing is done in a single phase. This is the fastest but provides no support for kerning.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.Phases.TWO
member.summary: Drawing is done in two phases; the background first and then the text. This is the default.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.Phases.MULTIPLE
member.summary: Drawing is done in multiple phases; once for each feature. This is the slowest but allows extreme ascenders and descenders to overflow into adjacent lines.

member.name: T:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.PopupMode
member.summary: Behavior of the standard edit control context menu.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.PopupMode.NEVER
member.summary: Never show the default editing menu.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.PopupMode.ALL
member.summary: Show default editing menu if clicking on the control.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.PopupMode.TEXT
member.summary: Show default editing menu only if clicking on text area.
member.remarks: To receive the event, this value must be used.

member.summary: A Boolean property. This is the default.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.PropertyType.INTEGER
member.summary: An integer property.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.PropertyType.STRING
member.summary: A string property.

member.name: T:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.SearchFlags
member.summary: Specifies the how patterns are matched when performing a search in a control.
member.remarks: This enumeration has a FlagsAttribute attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.SearchFlags.NONE
member.summary: Matches every instance of the search string.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.SearchFlags.MATCHCASE
member.summary: A match only occurs with text that matches the case of the search string.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.SearchFlags.WHOLEWORD
member.summary: A match only occurs if the characters before and after are not word characters.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.SearchFlags.WORDSTART
member.summary: A match only occurs if the character before is not a word character.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.SearchFlags.REGEX
member.summary: The search string should be interpreted as a regular expression. Regular expressions will only match ranges within a single line, never matching over multiple lines.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.SearchFlags.POSIX
member.summary: Treat regular expression in a more POSIX compatible manner by interpreting bare '(' and ')' for tagged sections rather than "\(" and "\)".

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.SearchFlags.CXX11REGEX
member.summary: The search string should be interpreted as a regular expression and use the C++11 <regex> standard library engine. The property can queried to determine if the regular expression is invalid. The ECMAScript flag is set on the regex object and documents will exhibit Unicode-compliant behaviour. Regular expressions will only match ranges within a single line, never matching over multiple lines.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.TabDrawMode.STRIKEOUT

member.summary: The rendering technology used in a control.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.Technology.DEFAULT
member.summary: Renders text using GDI. This is the default.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.Technology.DIRECTWRITE
member.summary: Renders text using Direct2D/DirectWrite. Since Direct2D buffers drawing, Scintilla's buffering can be turned off with .

member.summary: Specifies the change that triggered a event.
member.remarks: This enumeration has a FlagsAttribute attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.summary: Contents, styling or markers have been changed.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.UpdateChange.SELECTION
member.summary: Selection has been changed.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.UpdateChange.VSCROLL
member.summary: Scrolled vertically.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.UpdateChange.HSCROLL

member.name: T:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.VirtualSpace
member.summary: Enables virtual space for rectangular selections or in other circumstances or in both.
member.remarks: This enumeration has a FlagsAttribute attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.VirtualSpace.NONE
member.summary: Virtual space is not enabled. This is the default.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.VirtualSpace.RECTANGULARSELECTION
member.summary: Virtual space is enabled for rectangular selections.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.VirtualSpace.USERACCESSIBLE
member.summary: Virtual space is user accessible.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.VirtualSpace.NOWRAPLINESTART
member.summary: Prevents left arrow movement and selection from wrapping to the previous line.

member.name: T:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.WhitespaceMode
member.summary: Specifies the display mode of whitespace characters.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.WhitespaceMode.INVISIBLE
member.summary: The normal display mode with whitespace displayed as an empty background color.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.WhitespaceMode.VISIBLEALWAYS
member.summary: Whitespace characters are drawn as dots and arrows.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.WhitespaceMode.VISIBLEAFTERINDENT
member.summary: Whitespace used for indentation is displayed normally but after the first visible character, it is shown as dots and arrows.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.WhitespaceMode.VISIBLEONLYINDENT
member.summary: Whitespace used for indentation is displayed as dots and arrows.

member.name: T:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.WrapIndentMode
member.summary: Indenting behavior of wrapped sublines.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.WrapIndentMode.FIXED
member.summary: Wrapped sublines aligned to left of window plus the amount set by . This is the default.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.WrapIndentMode.SAME
member.summary: Wrapped sublines are aligned to first subline indent.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.WrapIndentMode.INDENT
member.summary: Wrapped sublines are aligned to first subline indent plus one more level of indentation.

member.name: T:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.WrapMode
member.summary: The line wrapping strategy.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.WrapMode.NONE
member.summary: Line wrapping is disabled. This is the default.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.WrapMode.WORD
member.summary: Lines are wrapped on word or style boundaries.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.WrapMode.CHAR
member.summary: Lines are wrapped between any character.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.WrapMode.WHITESPACE
member.summary: Lines are wrapped on whitespace.

member.name: T:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.WrapVisualFlagLocation
member.summary: Additional location options for line wrapping visual indicators.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.WrapVisualFlagLocation.DEFAULT
member.summary: Wrap indicators are drawn near the border. This is the default.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.WrapVisualFlagLocation.ENDBYTEXT
member.summary: Wrap indicators are drawn at the end of sublines near the text.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.WrapVisualFlagLocation.STARTBYTEXT
member.summary: Wrap indicators are drawn at the beginning of sublines near the text.

member.name: T:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.WrapVisualFlags
member.summary: The visual indicator used on a wrapped line.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.WrapVisualFlags.NONE
member.summary: No visual indicator is displayed. This the default.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.WrapVisualFlags.END
member.summary: A visual indicator is displayed at th end of a wrapped subline.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.WrapVisualFlags.START
member.summary: A visual indicator is displayed at the beginning of a subline. The subline is indented by 1 pixel to make room for the display.

member.name: F:ExtendedControls.Components.ScintillaNET.Enumerations.WrapVisualFlags.MARGIN
member.summary: A visual indicator is displayed in the number margin.

member.summary: Draws the slider arrows on both sides of the control.
member.param: position value of the slider, lowest being at the bottom. The range is between 0 and the controls height-9. The values will be adjusted if too large/small
If Unconditional is true, the slider is drawn, otherwise some logic is performed to determine is drawing is really neccessary.

member.name: T:ExtendedControls.ExtendedToolkit.Controls.KryptonToastNotificationPopup
member.summary: Non-visual component to show a notification window in the right lower corner of the screen. Adapted from: https://github.com/Tulpep/Notification-Popup-Window/blob/master/Tulpep.NotificationWindow/PopupNotifier.cs

member.summary: Event that is raised when the text in the notification window is clicked.

member.summary: Event that is raised when the notification window is manually closed.

member.summary: Event that is raised when the notification Appears.

member.summary: Event that is raised when the notification Disappears.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:ExtendedControls.ExtendedToolkit.Controls.StandardControls.GridView.DataGridViewAutoFilterColumnHeaderCell.DataGridView_ColumnWidthChanged(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnEventArgs)
member.summary: Invalidates the drop-down button bounds when a column width changes in the DataGridView control. A width change in any column of the control has the potential to affect the drop-down button location, depending on the current horizontal scrolling position and whether the changed column is to the left or right of the current column. It is easier to invalidate the button in all cases.
member.param: The object that raised the event.
A DataGridViewColumnEventArgs that contains the event data.

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

member.name: M:ExtendedControls.ExtendedToolkit.Controls.StandardControls.GridView.DataGridViewAutoFilterColumnHeaderCell.DataGridView_SizeChanged(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Invalidates the drop-down button bounds when the size of the DataGridView changes. This prevents a painting issue that occurs when the right edge of the control moves to the right and the control contents have previously been scrolled to the right.
member.param: The object that raised the event.
An EventArgs that contains the event data.

member.name: T:System.TimeSpan2
member.summary: Represents a time interval.
member.remarks: A TimeSpan2 object represents a time interval (duration of time or elapsed time) that is measured as a positive or negative number of days, hours, minutes, seconds, and fractions of a second. The TimeSpan2 structure can also be used to represent the time of day, but only if the time is unrelated to a particular date.

member.summary: Returns string representation of the value of this instance using the specified format.

An object that supplies format information about the current instance.

member.name: M:System.TimeSpan2.ToString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns string representation of the value of this instance using the specified format.
member.param: A TimeSpan format string.
member.returns: A string representation of value of the current object as specified by format.

remarks.para: The following table lists the standard TimeSpan format patterns.

item.description: This specifier is not culture-sensitive. It takes the form [-][d.]hh:mm:ss[.fffffff].
This specifier outputs only what is needed. It is culture-sensitive and takes the form [-][d:]h:mm:ss[.FFFFFFF].
This specifier always outputs days and seven fractional digits. It is culture-sensitive and takes the form [-]d:hh:mm:ss.fffffff.
This specifier outputs days, hours, minutes and seconds in the style defined by JIRA. It takes the form [w'w'] [d'd'] [h'h'] [m'm'] [s's'].
This specifier outputs days, hours, minutes, seconds and milliseconds in the style defined by ISO 8601. It takes the form 'P'[d'D']['T'[h'H'][m'M'][p3'S']].

remarks.para: The following table lists the standard TimeSpan format patterns.

item.description: The number of whole days in the time interval.
The number of whole days in the time interval, padded with leading zeros as needed.
The number of whole hours in the time interval that are not counted as part of days. Single-digit hours do not have a leading zero.
The number of whole hours in the time interval that are not counted as part of days. Single-digit hours have a leading zero.

member.returns:
A string that represents the value of this instance. The return value is of the form:
[-][d.]hh:mm:ss[.fffffff]

member.param: A string containing a time span to convert.
An array of allowable formats of .
An object that supplies culture-specific formatting information about .

When this method returns, contains the value equivalent to the time span contained in , if the conversion succeeded, or TimeSpan.Zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if or is null, or an element of is an empty string, or the format of is not exactly as specified by at least one of the format patterns in . This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if the parameter was converted successfully; otherwise, false.
